text: Google parent company Alphabet has stopped making diversity and inclusion a workplace priority, according to a filing Wednesday with US regulators.

title: Google scraps diversity 'aspirations,' citing role as federal contractor
text: Google is scrapping its diversity targets, citing "recent court decisions and U.S. Executive Orders." The company's chief people officer said in an internal memo that "in the future, we will no longer have aspirational goals," when it comes to diversity, equity and inclusion.

title: Google ‘Optimistic' About Seeing Quantum Computer-Powered Applications in 5 Years
text: Google is reportedly optimistic that it will release commercial quantum computing applications within five years. That achievement would be sooner than the several years to two decades often predicted by investors and experts, Reuters reported Wednesday (Feb. 5).

title: Google is the latest tech giant to move away from DEI, as it weighs implications for federal contracts
text: The decision marks the latest major corporate retreat from diversity, equity and inclusion practices.

title: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq close higher as Nvidia pops, Google slides
text: To get the latest market news, check out finance.yahoo.com US stocks recovered from losses on Wednesday to close higher on the day. Earnings from Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) and AMD (AMD) fell short, but Big Tech got a boost from a jump in Nvidia (NVDA) shares.

title: Google Q4: Beaten Down Despite The Beat, Here's Why
text: Alphabet Inc. a.k.a., Google's Q4 earnings report showed strong growth in Search, YouTube, and Cloud, despite a slight revenue miss and higher-than-expected capital expenditures. The recent selloff is likely due to concerns over capital expenditures and capacity constraints in Cloud, but GOOGL stock remains up over 20% in six months. Google's expanding margins, resilience in Search, and potential payoffs from Other Bets like Waymo and TPUs make it a compelling investment.

title: Google Unwinds Diversity Goals, Citing Trump's DEI Orders
text: The Silicon Valley giant also said it was reviewing other diversity programs and initiatives and would update them if they seemed risky or ineffective.

title: Google ends diversity hiring goals as it reviews DEI programs
text: Google has ended hiring targets tied to representation, BI confirmed. The company also said it is evaluating its DEI programs.

title: Google axes diversity hiring targets in latest DEI retreat by major firm
text: Google follows tech rivals like Meta and Amazon, who have recently pulled their diversity policies.

title: Google ditches DEI hiring goals
text: Google will no longer have diversity hiring targets and will review its diversity, equity, and inclusion programs, according to an email sent to employees seen by the Wall Street Journal.

title: Google scraps diversity-based hiring targets, WSJ reports
text: Alphabet's Google is scrapping its goal to hire more employees from historically underrepresented groups and is reviewing some of its diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.

Big Tech earnings have been strong overall, and there are several signs of a bull market persisting.

While my private portfolio focuses on dividend growth, The Dividend Income Accelerator Portfolio balances both dividend income and dividend growth. Investing in companies with strong dividend growth potential allows you to not only benefit from annually increasing dividend payments, but also from capital appreciation.

title: Why Alphabet Stock Was Sliding Today
text: Shares of Alphabet (GOOG -7.90%) (GOOGL -8.19%) were moving lower Wednesday morning after the tech giant reported fourth-quarter revenue that was slightly below estimates and its slowest top-line growth of 2024. Investors were also disappointed by the slowing growth of its cloud computing business.

title: AMD, Alphabet slide post-earnings: What Wall Street is saying
text: Wall Street investors are reacting negatively to the recent earnings results from tech giant Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) and semiconductor manufacturer Advanced Micro Devices (AMD). Yahoo Finance tech editor Dan Howley joins Morning Brief to highlight the takeaways from AMD's latest report, including its promising first quarter guidance and flat data center revenue.

title: Alphabet tanks as analysts admit results were mixed, leaving many questions
text: Results from Google owner Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ:GOOG) sent the shares down over 8% on Wednesday, though analysts highlighted there were many moving parts that made appraisal hard.  Investors seemed perturbed that the Cloud segment delivered revenue growth below expectations, offsetting the earnings beat.

title: Google opens its most powerful AI models to everyone, the next stage in its virtual agent push
text: Google on Wednesday released the Gemini 2.0 artificial intelligence model suite to everyone. The continued releases are part of a broader strategy for Google of investing heavily into "AI agents" as the AI arms race heats up among tech giants and startups alike.

title: Google says commercial quantum computing applications arriving within five years
text: Google aims to release commercial quantum computing applications within five years, Google's head of quantum told Reuters on Wednesday, in a challenge to Nvidia's predictions of a 20-year wait.

title: Google introduces new class of cheap AI models as cost concerns intensify
text: Alphabet's Google on Wednesday announced updates to its Gemini family of large language models, including a new product line with competitive pricing to low-cost artificial intelligence models like that of Chinese rival DeepSeek.

title: Alphabet stock price: Google shares fall over cloud performance and AI spending worries
text: Shares in Google's parent company, Alphabet (Nasdaq: GOOG), are down nearly 7% in premarket trading at the time of this writing. The fall comes a day after Google announced its fourth-quarter 2024 earnings results.

title: Alphabet's Plunge Opens The Door To A Great Opportunity For Investors
text: Alphabet's recent earnings report showed a slight revenue miss, causing a 7.3% stock drop, but the company remains a strong growth opportunity at a reasonable price. Despite some revenue declines in Google Network and 'Other Bets,' Alphabet's core segments, especially Google Cloud, demonstrated robust growth and profitability improvements. Alphabet's earnings per share and other profitability metrics significantly improved year over year, driven by strong performance in Google Cloud and other core segments.

title: Google Stock: Bullish Post-Earnings, Boosted By Cybersecurity Growth Catalysts
text: Google's balance sheet is impressive, with negative long-term debt, $110 billion in cash, and a forward dividend yield of 0.41% with lots of room to grow. In my opinion, any dip below $200 is a great buying opportunity. While Google had a small top line miss, the most important businesses continue to grow earnings at double digit rates.

title: Google: The More It Drops, The More I'll Buy
text: Google reported mixed Q4 earnings with an EPS beat and revenue miss, causing shares to drop 7%. However, both Search and Cloud showed solid growth momentum. The company's free cash flow surged 214% Y/Y, suggesting the potential for a significant stock buyback increase in 2025, enhancing shareholder value. Google's Cloud operation income (share) has surged. Free cash flow margins are expanding.

title: Google's Q4 Dip: Expect Shares To Rebound Quickly And Aggressively
text: Despite a minor 0.2% revenue miss, Google's revenue grew 12% YoY, and EPS beat expectations, highlighting strong financial performance. Google's Cloud segment grew 30% YoY, and Waymo's advancements in autonomous mobility underscore Alphabet's innovation and growth potential. The $75 billion CAPEX guidance, though high, is prudent compared to peers, and Google can comfortably afford it with strong cash generation.

title: Nasdaq 100 Slides as China's Apple Probe and Google's Earnings Miss Shake Market Sentiment
text: Apple drops 3% as China weighs App Store probe, while Google sinks 9% on weak earnings. Nvidia edges higher, but risks loom.
